words.def: the 2nd letter of the Greek alphabet
a regular route for a sentry or policeman
assist or encourage, usually in some wrongdoing
nocturnal mouselike mammal with forelimbs modified to form membranous wings and anatomical adaptations for echolocation by which they navigate
the money risked on a gamble
goddess of criminal rashness and its punishment
a terrorist organization organized in 1959 by student activists who were dissatisfied with the moderate nationalism of the traditional Basque party
a beverage made by steeping tea leaves in water
a light strong brittle grey toxic bivalent metallic element
a soft silvery metallic element of the alkali earth group
a hard grey lustrous metallic element that is highly resistant to corrosion
a highly unstable radioactive element (the heaviest of the halogen series)
